text:
When it comes to keeping track of diabetes, the manual process can be a bit of a pain. Fortunately, technology has stepped in and provided us with many tools to monitor blood glucose levels, receive alerts and reminders and keep track of carbohydrates consumption all within our fingertips. Below listed are some diabetic apps that help you better understand glucose management. * MyFitnessPal: A calorie tracking app for monitoring your diet. This helps calculate carbohydrates, proteins and fats for users, aiding them in calculating insulin dose.
* LogFrog: Tracks various aspects of life including food intake, dosage, insulin injection and even tracks activity level ensuring overall well-round information.
OneTouch Reveal : An easy-to-understand user interface shows both short and long-term glucose trends while also providing medication reminders.
*One Drop: Track carbohydrate ratio, provide meal planning suggestions, offer access to expert assistance, all accessible directly through app's message box.
GLook Glass Diabetes Tracker :This device resembles smart wearables, it allows continuous, automatic tracking while simultaneously showing the results graphically.
* PredictBGL - This free service calculates potential BG rise & fall predictions helping diabetic decide on ideal time & quantity of foods / meds according their BGL fluctuations
These smartphone applications make lives simpler by streamlining numerous variables that affect the sugar levels.
